title: Find the main standpoint of an argument (2 mins/HIT on average) [pilot study]
description: Given arguments to various controversies, choose the correct author's standpoint and find it in the text
Answer.feedback: The first question seemed to agree with both standpoints, but favor one because the other was a weaker reason.  There is no option for "both", but it still seemed to take a stance, so I selected the slightly favored option.  I would appreciate something in the instructions noting what to do if the author favors both, but one more strongly - should I choose "no stance," or the more strongly favored stance?

A few examples in the instructions might be good.
